meanings.definition: To attract and hold the attention or interest of someone.
meanings.sent1: The magician's tricks never fail to fascinate the children.
meanings.sent2: The movie's plot fascinated the audience from start to finish.
meanings.sent3: The cat's antics never fail to fascinate the dog next door.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious old house seemed to fascinate the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The colorful illustrations in the book truly fascinate young readers.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to be extremely interested in something.
meanings.sent1: The new video game fascinated Tim for hours on end.
meanings.sent2: The rare artifacts in the museum fascinated history buffs.
meanings.sent3: The idea of time travel never fails to fascinate science fiction fans.
meanings.sent4: The intricate details of the painting fascinated art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent5: The exotic birds in the zoo always fascinate visitors with their vibrant colors.
